Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: "You and Obama are against any spending cuts." Not at all. Obama and I both propose long-term cuts to entitlement spending. We both support squeezing more efficiency from the system and slowing spending growth. What we oppose is cuts to infrastructure and safety net spending during a slow recovery from a deep recession. We both oppose cuts that are arbitrary or that cut beneficial programs. We don't support cuts that will dismantle Medicare and Social Security for future generations, as Paul Ryan will propose today. We don't support cuts that disproportionately fall on working people and future generations. I have to ask, did you even look at the number I presented? Do you have any solution to present? Of course not. You are simply intent on raving about "Obama" this and "Obama" that? That is why you are stupid. I think if you applied yourself, you may have something worthwhile to contribute..

This is a turnaround just missed so far but everyone but insiders. The article is right there on yahoo. All very clear. Going so much higher and a double to price target which makes sense given value of investments and then you add in earnings... crazy...but love it. FNHC

Topic.Title: It looks like Obama wants to bankrupt America

Message.Msg: Roosevelt never experienced a baby boom or life expectancy in the upper 70s. That would be a 6% cut to BOTH Medicare & Social Security. So are you willing to reduce your Social Security check by 6% AND add about $600 to your Medicare premium? Should the cuts be scaled to income, because such a move would fall disproportionately on the middle class and poor otherwise? Or are do you think the entire brunt of the cuts should be borne by younger people? Proposing cuts only for those under 55 (which would NOT affect the ten year spending projections through 2022) as Ryan and many Democrats have done? The $1.3 billion over ten years in foreign aid I cited was humanitarian aid. Military aid is in a separate line, under defense spending.

Topic.Title: How many Melowese Richardsons does it take to change an election result?

Message.Msg: Ah yes, the poster child for voter fraud in this country. One old lady who cast an absentee ballot and voted at the poll, only one of which was counted due to internal controls and who cast votes for four other people for the person they wanted to vote for. There may have been some minor fraud involved, she has been caught and is being prosecuted--as she should be. All I can think is "The horror! Our Democracy is at an end!" With this "horror" in hand, you people propose a series of initiatives aimed at massive voter suppression--none of which would have prevented this woman from casting an absentee ballot and a ballot at the poll or the absentee ballots of the four other people she "helped". I try not to pull out the #$%$ word too much, but this really reminds me of #$%$s--using insignificant actions of individuals to justify massive suppression.

Topic.Title: How many Melowese Richardsons does it take to change an election result?

Message.Msg: ...“You could be right when you combine all the voter fraud of old ladies” – frog boy Hey, tadpole, are you still sitting on your lily pad crying in the pond while making up more excuses for your drubbing in the recent election? Aren’t you callow Tea Party types the ones who are constantly harping about accepting personal responsibility for your own actions? Will you never get over your humiliating defeat? Apparently not, because you always quote from your hero, Barry Goldwater’s campaign slogan – you know – the one that led to the worst drubbing in the popular vote in the history of our country. You stick with those values, and rather than admitting why you got skunked, you try to make stuff up? Making stuff up is what got you in the predicament you’re in, fool! Now, I suppose you blame that overwhelming rejection of Goldwater’s extreme conservatism (and, sadly, still yours today) on voter fraud of old ladies. Gee, back in ’64, you clowns hadn’t yet come up with the concept of blaming the media, as you pathetically do today. You asked how many Melowese Richardsons it takes to change an election result. Well, obviously she hasn’t yet been convicted of anything, and you know full well that Richardson truthfully identified herself at the polls and voted in her own name because she didn’t think her absentee ballot would arrive in time. She also assisted others in her household in sending in ballots. Was she overzealous – I would tend to think she was. So, for the sake of your very lame argument, let’s say that all five of the alleged votes should be discounted. So, to answer your question, Obama’s 60,459,974 winning votes, minus Romney’s 57,653,982 losing votes equals a difference of 2,805,992 votes. Or, at 5 illegal votes each, how many Melowese Richardsons would it take to change the result. Well over a half million of her, or 561,199 to be precise (popular vote). So, if you still want to stick with your insane and sorry excuse for your overwhelming defeat, you might be here a while listing out the other half million Melowese’s. Oh, and btw, if we want to argue about the actual election results from YOUR side, rather than picking on one individual from your opponent…and the considerably more influence of illegal activities ORGANIZED BY THE PARTY itself…perhaps you should peruse the headlines from last Fall. Voter suppression, the GOP way: “Republican National Committee Engulfed in Suspected Voter Fraud in at Least 10 Florida Counties” - September 28, 2012 “Virginia Voter Fraud Case Expands to Focus on GOP Firm Strategic Allied Consulting Headed by Nathan Sproul” – November 3, 2012 “More Sketchy Details About GOP Voter Registration Group Uncovered” – Dec. 3, 2012 “GOP-Linked Firm's Fraud Puts Thousands Of Voters At Risk” – December 9, 2012 “Rick Scott Mum As Election Fraud Scandal Rocks Florida” – Dec. 10, 2012 “GOP Group Filed Dead Woman's Voter Registration Form” – Dec. 19,2012 “More Trouble For GOP Firm Linked To Voter Registration Fraud” – Jan. 3 2013 “GOP Group Filed Dead Woman's Voter Registration Form” – Dec. 19,2012 Oh, Boo-Hoo, that bad Melowese Richardson is to blame for everything. “In your heart, you know he’s an idiot.”

Topic.Title: How many Melowese Richardsons does it take to change an election result?

Message.Msg: Who said I tolerate voter fraud? She should be prosecuted. It is a serious criminal offense. It does not have serious implications for our electoral system, however. We should not destroy our democracy because one woman committed fraud. We should deal with the fraud. As I noted, she is being prosecuted and should be. She is not a good person. She is a criminal. You, on the other hand, think Melonese Richardson's fraud is reason to disenfranchise thousands or millions of legal voters. I will not let you nor Melonese Richardson diminish the power or importance of voting. I am very, very jealous of the individual right to vote. Whatever you think you'll do to prevent any encroachment on the individual right to own a gun, multiply it by 1,000 for what I would do to protect the individual right to vote. We maintain our freedom by voting for our government. "I stand by my initial statement; they have no shame." Complete lack of self-awareness.
perfect one
nice report

Topic.Title: How many Melowese Richardsons does it take to change an election result?

Message.Msg: "You, on the other hand, think Melonese Richardson's fraud is reason to disenfranchise thousands or millions of legal voters." And you and too many others continue to make the assumption that she is one of the very few, one of those that the system caught and that even in Florida, they have sufficient controls to catch these types of voters. One person will not impact an election, but as we have seen in the past history of this country, even future Presidents can cheat and get away with it, Chicago has a long and sorted history of voter irregularities. As for the comment of one poster stating she has not been convicted and that she should be presumed innocent, he is absolutely correct. We should not therefore assume the alternative that she is innocent and her actions are rare and inconsequential. It should be investigated, not swept away.

Topic.Title: How many Melowese Richardsons does it take to change an election result?

Message.Msg: "You and too many others continue to make the assumption that she is one of the very few, one of those that the system caught and that even in Florida, they have sufficient controls to catch these types of voters." Then go after the fraud and put systems in place to identify fraud. Of course, that involves that great Conservative bugaboo--government spending. Voter ID rules, purging voter rolls, shortening the absentee ballot period or any of the other myriad voter suppression policies you people push would have done NOTHING to stop Melonese Richardson or any imaginary army of little old ladies. What caught her was normal voter fraud techniques. Just like normal auditing exposed the malfeasance at LG. You don't need to disenfranchise thousands of voters. You need to audit your results. The fact that these techniques ARE successful at identifying cases of fraud does not lead to the conclusion that the entire system is corrupt. Quite the opposite. Yet that is the argument you you persistently push here. Systemic voter fraud would be revealed by differences in vote tallies from polls and exit polls--as happened in Iran. That simply has not been the case here.
Thanks for sharing !
